visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a column chart. The chart should display the amount of Vitamin A in micrograms for five different foods. The chart should have a title '5 Foods High in Vitamin A' and a subtitle with a link to the source. The y-axis should be labeled 'Vitamin A in microgram' with the values formatted to include 'mcg'. The tooltip should use HTML formatting to display the food name and the corresponding Vitamin A value. The data should be loaded from a CSV file embedded in the HTML. The chart should have data labels enabled and formatted to display the Vitamin A value in micrograms.

data.csv:
Food,Vitamin A
Beef Liver,6421
Lamb Liver,2122
Cod Liver Oil,1350
Mackerel,388
Tuna,214

visualization_explanation: The Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a column chart that visualizes the amount of Vitamin A in micrograms for five different foods. The chart title is set to '5 Foods High in Vitamin A' and includes a subtitle with a link to the source data. The y-axis is labeled 'Vitamin A in microgram' with the values formatted to include 'mcg'. The tooltip is customized to use HTML formatting, displaying the food name and the corresponding Vitamin A value in a structured table format. The data for the chart is loaded from a CSV string embedded within the chartOptions object. The plot options include disabling markers for the series and enabling data labels that display the Vitamin A value in micrograms directly on the columns.
